Social gatherings: Organizing regular meetups, potlucks, and game nights to spend quality time with friends and family.
Email and messaging apps: While not as instant as phones, email and messaging apps can still be used to communicate, albeit without the convenience of voice and video calls.
Video conferencing: Platforms like Zoom, Skype, and Google Meet can be used to conduct virtual meetings and calls, allowing for face-to-face communication.
Community bulletin boards: Public spaces could have bulletin boards where people can post messages, advertisements, and requests for help.
Landline phones: Although not as widespread as mobile phones, landline phones could still be used to make and receive calls, especially in homes and offices.
